body: Thanks for the updates. I like the changes. Were you able to discern the causes for the test failures?
This change has been tested now for both windows and linux. Merging it. Thanks.
Looks good. Thank you. Will be merging the change.

Looks good to me. Will wait for a couple of  hours and then merge this one.
Code changes look OK to me. Will commit later today if no objections appear.
Looks OK to me but I don't fully understand it.

Cloudera parcels installs in a different directory path than Cloudera packages. 
Example with HBase: /opt/cloudera/parcels/lib/hbase vs. /usr/lib/hbase

We needed to modify traf_cloudera_mods98 since it needs to copy the hbase-trx*.jar file to the correct <path>/hbase/lib directory. We also needed to modify sqenvcom.sh to set the correct classpaths with the correct locations.
Looks good to me Selva. Did we test with ODB to check if it helped? I can merge it now since Dave has reviewed already.
I tested it using Trafci to confirm the behavior when ODBC Server is involved. I am expecting the ODB to behave in the same way

I like the refactoring done in CharType.cpp. Seems like much cleaner code. Similarly the handling of doubled quotes in the TEXT table is cleaner now (this bedeviled me when I did the ALTER TABLE HBASE_OPTIONS stuff).

I measured the amount of memory allocated in RMS shared segment using GET STATISTICS FOR RMS ALL command before and after this change when full SQL regressions were run.
Before:
Node 0
Stats Heap High WM 2,551,176
Node 1
Stats Heap High WM 1,824,432
After EXPLAIN_IN_RMS is changed to 'ON'
Node 0
Stats Heap High WM 2,811,504
Node 1
Stats Heap High WM 1,839,480
The changes look good to me. The only comments I had were fairly minor.

Thanks Dave! Could a committer please commit this change?

THANK YOU!

I'm unsure of the status of this change. Is there consensus that it should be committed as-is, or are there additional changes needed? (I'm neutral on the matter due to my relative ignorance.)
Excited about seeing the benefits if this change! Please consider adding some information about old and new plans seen with this change to the JIRA.

An example of old and new plan affected by this change:

Scenario: Workstation sqlci session with no CQDs (other than the defaults). Create the following tables:

CREATE TABLE TRAFODION.SCH.SALT1
  (
    A                                INT NO DEFAULT NOT NULL NOT DROPPABLE
  , B                                INT NO DEFAULT NOT NULL NOT DROPPABLE
  , C                                CHAR(20) CHARACTER SET ISO88591 COLLATE
      DEFAULT DEFAULT NULL
  , PRIMARY KEY (A ASC, B ASC)
  )
  SALT USING 4 PARTITIONS
;

CREATE TABLE SALT2 LIKE SALT1;

Then consider the following query: insert into salt2 select a,b,c from salt1.

If the cardinality of salt1 is 15e4 or less, we get a serial plan (with or without these changes).

If the cardinality of salt1 is 16e4 or greater, we get a parallel plan. Without the changes, the scan is done in parallel from 2 ESPs but the insert is done in the master. With the changes, both the scan and the insert are done in parallel, under one set of ESPs.

Without the changes:

> > explain options 'f' insert into salt2 select a,b,c from salt1 <<+ cardinality 16e4 >>;

LC   RC   OP   OPERATOR              OPT       DESCRIPTION           CARD

---

5    .    6    root                            x                     1.60E+005
3    4    5    tuple_flow                                            1.60E+005
.    .    4    trafodion_insert                SALT2                 1.00E+000
2    .    3    esp_exchange                    1:2(hash2) (m)        1.60E+005
1    .    2    sort                                                  1.60E+005
.    .    1    trafodion_scan                  SALT1                 1.60E+005

--- SQL operation complete.

With the changes:

> > explain options 'f' insert into salt2 select a,b,c from salt1 <<+ cardinality 16e4 >>;

LC   RC   OP   OPERATOR              OPT       DESCRIPTION           CARD

---

5    .    6    root                            x                     1.60E+005
4    .    5    esp_exchange                    1:2(hash2)            1.60E+005
2    3    4    tuple_flow                                            1.60E+005
.    .    3    trafodion_insert                SALT2                 1.00E+000
1    .    2    sort                                                  1.60E+005
.    .    1    trafodion_scan                  SALT1                 1.60E+005

--- SQL operation complete.
